backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor representing a placeholder backend canister.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report defining a homepage image‑loading update tied to App.tsx with metadata and linked components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing key frontend files including App.tsx, modal, CSS, Tailwind config, image preview hook, and asset URL utility.
frontend/index.css: Root-level Tailwind CSS theme variables and dark‑mode overrides for colors, borders, and backgrounds.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main interactive Valentine page with Yes/No logic, escalating Yes button, customizable photo picker, and modal trigger.
frontend/src/components/ValentineModal.t: Popup modal showing a celebration image with its own image picker, escape/backdrop close logic, and decorative animations.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous backend actor using Internet Identity and react-query.
frontend/src/hooks/useClientImagePreview: Hook enabling client-side image selection with preview, validation, load tracking, fallback handling, and error management.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and provider for Internet Identity authentication, handling identity loading, login flow, and status flags.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and custom CSS variables for light/dark Valentine-themed colors and animation utilities.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, wrapping it with React Query and Internet Identity providers before rendering App.
frontend/src/utils/assetUrl.ts: Utility to build asset URLs using Vite’s BASE_URL, ensuring paths resolve correctly in production.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration extending theme colors, radius, animations, and enabling plugins like typography and container queries.
project_state.json: Stores project metadata, feature requirements, issues, and architectural notes for the Valentine website’s development state.
